org.stuntaz.libqcw.blobs
Class QUtils

java.lang.Object
  org.stuntaz.libqcw.blobs.QUtils

public final class QUtils
extends java.lang.Object

A collection of static utility methods for helping to read, write, and decode QCW files.

QUtils

public QUtils()
Method Detail

getSize

public static int getSize(java.lang.Class type)
Returns the size, in bytes, required by the specified class as it exists in the file format.

Parameters:
type - the class to check
Returns:
the number of bytes required by type in the file format

getQStringSize

public static int getQStringSize(java.lang.String s)
Returns the size of the QString resulting from the specified value. This size is calculated in "non-goofy" mode (see QString for a description of goofy mode).

Parameters:
s - the string to check
Returns:
the size of the resulting QString in bytes as it would exist in the file

readVal

public static long readVal(int numBytes,
                           java.io.InputStream stream)
                    throws java.io.IOException
Reads the specified number of bytes from the input stream and returns the value. This assumes a little endian format on the input stream.

Parameters:
numBytes - the number of bytes to read
stream - the stream from which to read
Returns:
the value read
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the file

writeVal

public static void writeVal(long value,
                            int numBytes,
                            java.io.OutputStream output)
                     throws java.io.IOException
Writes the specified value in the specified number of bytes to the output stream. This writes the value in little endian format.

Parameters:
value - the value to write
numBytes - the number of bytes to write
output - the stream on which to write
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing the file

writeQString

                                java.io.OutputStream output,
                                boolean goofyLengthMode)
                         throws java.io.IOException
Writes the value as a QString to the specified output stream.

Parameters:
value - the value to write
output - the stream on which to write
goofyLengthMode - whether to use the QString goofy mode when calculating the length
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs while writing

writeQString

public static void writeQString(java.lang.String value,
                                java.io.OutputStream output)
                         throws java.io.IOException
This is equivalent to writeQString(String, OutputStream, boolean) with goofyLengthMode set to false.

Parameters:
value - the value to write
output - the output stream on which to write
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs while writing

                                           boolean goofyLengthMode)
                                    throws java.io.IOException
Reads a QString from the input stream.

Parameters:
stream - the stream from which to read
goofyLengthMode - whether to read the length in goofy mode or not
Returns:
the value read
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs while reading

readQString

public static java.lang.String readQString(java.io.InputStream stream)
                                    throws java.io.IOException
Reads a QString from the input stream. The QString read will not use goofy mode.

Parameters:
stream - the stream from which to read
Returns:
the value read
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O exception occurs while reading

qtimeToDate

public static java.util.Date qtimeToDate(long qtime)
Converts a 32-bit time as present in the file format to a Date object. Note that while a long is used, the value should fit in 32 bits.

Parameters:
qtime - the time to convert
Returns:
the equivalent Date object

dateToQTime

public static long dateToQTime(java.util.Date date)
Converts a Date object to a 32-bit value that be used in the file format. Note that while a long is returned, the value will fit in 32 bits.

Parameters:
date - the date to convert
Returns:
the equivalent 32-bit value
